meanings.definition: A soft, finely stratified sedimentary rock that formed from consolidated mud or clay and can be split easily into fragile slabs.
meanings.sent1: The shale crumbled into small pieces when touched.
meanings.sent2: The geologist studied the layers of shale in the rock formation.
meanings.sent3: The children skipped rocks made of shale across the pond.
meanings.sent4: The shale walls of the canyon stood tall and majestic.
meanings.sent5: The shale's layers told a story of ancient times.

meanings.definition: A piece of shale used as a roofing tile or in building construction.
meanings.sent1: The roofer carefully placed each shale to create a sturdy roof.
meanings.sent2: The old house had a beautiful facade made of shale.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel balanced a shale on its head like a hat.
meanings.sent4: The artist painted a picture of a house with walls of shale.
meanings.sent5: The sound of rain on the shale roof was soothing.
